Next, apply a cooling gel to help minimize discomfort during treatment (you can also apply a cooling gel or ice pack to the skin after your treatment). Then, hold the device against the skin and press the button to emit a pulse of light. Move the device to the next area and repeat the process. Be sure to overlap each pulse slightly to ensure even coverage. When you’re done, moisturize the treatment area to help soothe the skin and minimize dryness or flakiness between sessions.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowMeet the ExpertsWhy trust ELLE BeautyAs a leading publisher of fashion, lifestyle, and beauty content, ELLE.com is committed to highlighting the best products in various categories by personally testing the latest and most innovative products, interviewing countless experts, and vetting customer-loved items. Best Overall

Braun IPL Hair Removal

Pros
  • Adjusts to your skin tone
  • Portable
Cons
  • Requires Wi-Fi connection

This FDA-approved device from Braun is virtually painless and designed to be as foolproof as possible. Different skin tones require different intensities of light, and the device’s sensor automatically adjusts to accommodate your particular needs. If the standard setting feels like too much, you can also choose between gentle and extra gentle; the tool’s two interchangeable heads allow you to zap away hair on everything from your legs and bikini line to your underarms and face.

Key features: Skin sensor, comfort modes, 10 intensity levels

Flashes: 400,000

What’s included: Device, cord, travel case, Venus Extra Smooth razor, two interchangeable heads

Usage: Once a week for 4-12 weeks until you start to see desired results, then once every 1-2 months

Amazon rating: 4.3/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “The app was very useful for the device settings and monitoring progress. I was surprised by how much information the device was able to read as far as skin tone, session usage, and the ease of changing settings. The light wasn’t too bright, and I did not feel anything on my skin except the device (no uncomfortable warmth or heat from the device). The fan was loud and ran constantly while the device was plugged in, but otherwise, I think this is very cool tech to have at home. I am impressed. After three weeks of sessions, I’ve noticed less growth on my legs and underarms. I was a bit nervous because my skin is very pale and body hair is a medium brown, but the device calibrated everything easily and zapped away. The sessions were fast and easy to do after a shower or shave.” —Megan Victoria, ELLE senior visual researcher

Best for Maintenance

Foreo Peach 2 IPL Hair Removal Device & Peach Cooling Prep Gel Bundle

This device works on large but is best used for precision in smaller regions. While hair removal can be painful, the Foreo Peach 2 device works to encourage as much ease as possible with a cooling prep gel, Ta -Sonic massage during your session, as well as a cooling airflow as you zap away those pesky hairs. Even better, using the Foreo app helps to keep you on top of your at-home treatments.

Key features: 5 intensity levels, T-sonic massage, cooling air

Flashes: 120 flashes per minute

What’s included: Device, charging cable with plug adaptors, cleaning cloth, gel

Usage: 1 time every 2 weeks for the first 12 weeks

Foreo rating: 3.7/5 stars

A Foreo reviewer says: “It's an absolute amazing device! It's super easy to use at home for hair removal, long term. It's painless and very quick. You have to be a bit patient to see full results, but you will see a difference in a few weeks and it's absolutely worth the wait. Dark hairs will be gone and then it's a matter of keeping track.”

You should start to see hair reduction even with the first treatment, but sometimes six or more treatments are needed to get to the desired results.”

Keep in mind that other factors like skin tone, hair color, and thickness can also affect success. “Some people may experience complete hair loss in the treated areas, while others may require occasional touch-ups to maintain smoothness,” adds Dr. Rokhsar. “It can take several months to see the full results of IPL hair removal, as the hair growth cycle is gradual and some hair follicles may require multiple treatments to effectively be targeted. The results of IPL hair removal can last for months or even years, depending on the individual.”

Does IPL hair removal hurt?

“IPL hair removal can cause some discomfort or mild pain during treatment, but the level of discomfort can vary depending on based on an individual’s skin sensitivity, the treatment area, and the intensity of the device,” says Dr. Rokhsar. “However, most people report that IPL hair removal is less painful than other methods such as waxing or threading.”

To help reduce the chances of pain, Dr. Kobets recommends choosing a device with cooling technology. For an in-office treatment, she’s a fan of Sciton’s BBL. “This professional-level device has an ‘In Motion’ option where the heat and energy build up gradually, and the crystal keeps the skin surface cool,” she says. “The latest HERO version also pulses continuously to avoid any ‘striping’ and is relatively safer.”

What’s the best way to prep for IPL hair removal?

Dr. Rokhsar and Dr. Kobets recommend a few essential tips:

  • “Avoid sun exposure and tanning for at least two weeks prior to IPL treatment,” says Dr. Rokhsar. “Sun exposure can increase the risk of skin damage and complications and make the treatment less effective. If you are tan, do not use an IPL hair removal device. Instead, wait for your skin to return to its normal color.”
  • “Avoid using certain skincare products such as retinoids, AHAs, BHAs, or exfoliants for at least one to two weeks prior to IPL treatment, as these products can increase skin sensitivity and make the treatment more uncomfortable,” he warns. Also, Dr. Kobets says don’t use IPL devices on any existing rashes or areas of inflammation. “If you have a history of cold sores, make sure your dermatologist prescribes you oral cold sore medications prior to treatment,” Dr. Rokhsar adds.
  • “Shave the treatment area one to two days prior to IPL treatment, as the device works best on hair that is at or slightly below the surface of the skin,” he says. Additionally, “don’t wax, tweeze, or use depilatory creams four to six weeks before your procedure,” Dr. Kobets advises. “Doing so will be a waste of time and money for you since those plucked hairs are the actual target the IPL is trying to get.”
  • “Read the instructions and make sure you understand the device’s features, settings, and safety protocols before starting,” Dr. Rokhsar notes.
  • “Before using the device on a larger area, perform a patch test on a small area of skin,” he says. “Wait at least 24 hours after the patch test to ensure you don’t experience any adverse reactions.”

    What's the best way to use an IPL device?

    “First, choose the appropriate setting for your skin type and hair color,” explains Dr. Rokhsar. “Start with a lower setting and gradually increase the intensity if necessary. Next, apply a cooling gel to help minimize discomfort during treatment (you can also apply a cooling gel or ice pack to the skin after your treatment). Then, hold the device against the skin and press the button to emit a pulse of light. Move the device to the next area and repeat the process. Be sure to overlap each pulse slightly to ensure even coverage. When you’re done, moisturize the treatment area to help soothe the skin and minimize dryness or flakiness between sessions.”
